text: Stanley Robert Kelley (14 June 1920 – 1993) was an English footballer who played as a left-back for Coventry City. ==Playing career== Kelley played for Herberts Athletic and Coventry City. He played one game as a guest for Port Vale during World War II in a 1–0 win over Walsall at the Old Recreation Ground on 19 January 1946. ==Statistics== Source: {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !rowspan="2"|Division !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|FA Cup !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |Coventry City |1946–47||Second Division||4||0||0||0||4||0 |} ==References== Category:1920 births Category:1993 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Coventry Category:English footballers Category:Association football fullbacks Category:Coventry City F.C. players Category:Port Vale F.C. wartime guest players Category:English Football League players
title: Stan Kelley
